alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 7:35PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wicomico and northeastern Dorchester Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Cambridge, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hurlock, Hebron, Sharptown, Vienna, Mardela Springs, Galestown, Brookview, Eldorado, Andrews, Bucktown and Linkwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
